definition: lit. chicken feathers and garlic skins (idiom)/fig. trivial (matter)
fowl/chicken/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(slang) prostitute

hair/feather/down/wool/mildew/mold/coarse or semifinished/young/raw/careless/unthinking/nervous/scared/(of currency) to devalue or depreciate/classifier for Chinese fractional monetary unit ( = 角[jiao3] , = one-tenth of a yuan or 10 fen 分[fen1])
surname Mao
garlic/CL:頭|头[tou2],瓣[ban4]
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi

sentences.english: Last week we got into this huge fight over the stupidest thing.
sentences.chinese: 上週我們因爲一點雞毛蒜皮的事大吵了一架。

sentences.english: She often hits the roof because of trifles.
sentences.chinese: 她常爲雞毛蒜皮的小事大發雷霆。

sentences.english: Small things that you do can make a huge impact on the world.
sentences.chinese: 你做的一件雞毛蒜皮的事也能對世界產生巨大的影響。

sentences.english: Even trivial things can set Arthur and his wife at loggerheads.
sentences.chinese: 即使是雞毛蒜皮的小事也能使阿瑟和他妻子吵起來。

sentences.english: My mother tends to chatter over little things.
sentences.chinese: 我媽媽總喜歡因爲雞毛蒜皮的小事碎碎念。

sentences.english: Talk people tend to fall into a non-trivial quarrel in the long-winded.
sentences.chinese: 議論別人往往陷入雞毛蒜皮的是非口舌中糾纏不清。

sentences.english: But microblogs in China are not just about trivia.
sentences.chinese: 但中國的微博並不僅僅侷限於雞毛蒜皮的小事兒。

sentences.english: Talking about others will make your trapped in ravelment by trifiles.
sentences.chinese: 議論別人往往陷入雞毛蒜皮的是非口舌中糾纏不清。
不要爲這些雞毛蒜皮的事爭吵。
他們在一些雞毛蒜皮的小事上爭吵不休。
吵架常常是由一些雞毛蒜皮的小事而引起的。

sentences.english: I'd calculate our gas mileage -- figure out useless statistics on things like grocery spending.
sentences.chinese: 我會計算油耗還有雜貨花銷等雞毛蒜皮的小事。

definition: not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
to haggle over every ounce/(fig.) to fuss over minor matters/to split hairs
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
to gesticulate while talking (idiom)/to explain by waving one's hands/to criticize or give orders summarily
to look anxious (idiom)/to look miserable
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to make a big fuss over a minor issue (idiom)
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to imitate the dog and steal chicken (idiom)/to pilfer/to dally with women/to have affairs
to have a grudge against
noisy/raucous/to shout and scream
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to force someone to do something
